full_summary:
### RFAP - Airfield Pavement Materials Engineering Technical Services - SOA

#### Solicitation # AC232402

**Request for Abbreviated Proposals (RFAP)**

#### Background
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites qualified consulting firms to submit Abbreviated Proposals for a Standing Offer Agreement (SOA) to provide technical services related to airfield pavement materials engineering. The services required will be on an “as and when required” basis for various locations across Canada, excluding Nunavut.

#### Scope of Services
The following technical services are required for this contract:

* Airfield pavement structural studies
* Airfield pavement materials engineering
* Airfield pavement forensic failure investigations
* Airfield pavement research studies

#### Requirements
Firms interested in providing these services must be able to demonstrate expertise in the following areas:

* Project Management
* Concrete Design and Analysis (Lead Engineer)
* Asphalt Design and Analysis (Lead Engineer)
* Geotechnical Engineering (Lead Engineer)

#### Agreement Details
The SOA will be awarded for a period of three (3) years with a maximum estimated value of $1,000,000.00. Call-ups under the SOA are expected to be valued between $20,000.00 and $200,000.00.

#### Tendering
Bidders can obtain bilingual documents and submit their Abbreviated Proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System by February 6, 2024, at 14:00 (EST). Please note that there is a fee associated with accessing the system; see the MERX website for details.

#### Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation criteria outlined in the RFAP document will be used to assess the Abbreviated Proposals. This evaluation will focus on the expertise of the firm and the proposed project team.

#### Contract Award
Contract award results will be posted on the DCC website, and firms that are successful will be contacted directly.

Please submit your not-for-profit bid by visiting [https://www.merx.com](https://www.merx.com)
